content:
A long-time fan of the series! You'll definitely appreciate the new features and gameplay mechanics that Rift Apart brings to the table.

As for multiplayer, Insomniac Games has confirmed that Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart will be a single-player only experience. The game's focus is on delivering a rich, cinematic, and immersive single-player campaign, with a strong narrative and engaging gameplay.

While there won't be any traditional multiplayer modes, the game will feature some online components, such as leaderboards and challenges, that will allow you to compete with other players and track your progress. However, these features will be asynchronous, meaning you won't be playing with or against other players in real-time.

Insomniac Games has stated that they wanted to focus on creating a compelling single-player experience that lives up to the series' standards, and they didn't want to compromise on the game's quality by trying to include multiplayer modes. Considering the game's emphasis on storytelling, exploration, and action, I think this decision makes sense.

That being said, the lack of multiplayer might be a disappointment for some fans. However, I'm sure the game's single-player campaign will be engaging and memorable, and the online features will provide some extra replay value and competition.
